#Text=Dave Zirin
#Text=Dave Zirin is an American political sportswriter .

#Text=He is the sports editor for The Nation , a weekly progressive magazine dedicated to politics and culture , and writes a blog named Edge of Sports : the weekly sports column by Dave Zirin . [ 1 ]
#Text=As of January 2017 , he has authored nine books .
#Text=Early life and education
#Text=Zirin was born to a Jewish family [ 2 ] in New York City . [ 3 ]
#Text=He graduated from Macalester College in St. Paul , Minnesota . [ 3 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Zirin was the host of the Edge of Sports Podcast , hosted by the Slate/ Panoply network .
#Text=He also co-hosted " The Collision : Where Sports and Politics Collide on Pacifica Radio " with former NBA player Etan Thomas .

column1: #Text=Zirin is a contributor to The Nation , and has been a columnist for SLAM Magazine , and The Progressive .
#Text=He has been a guest on ESPN 's Outside The Lines and Democracy Now ! . [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=His first book , What ’s My Name , Fool ? Sports and Resistance in the United States ( Haymarket Books ) has entered its third printing . [ 4 ] [ 6 ]

#Text=Zirin has published Welcome to the Terrordome : The Pain , Politics , and Promise of Sports , and A People ’s History of Sports in the United States , a sports-related volume in the manner of Howard Zinn 's A People 's History of the United States series for The New Press . [ 4 ] [ 7 ]
#Text=In addition to “ What ’s My Name , Fool ? ” , he has also published “ The Muhammad Ali Handbook ” for MQ Publications . [ 8 ]
#Text=Zirin is also the published children ’s book author of “ My Name is Erica Montoya de la Cruz ” ( RC Owen ) . [ 9 ]

#Text=" A People 's History of Sports " forms the basis of a documentary co-written and narrated by Zirin called Not Just A Game : Power , Politics and American Sports , produced by the Media Education Foundation . [ 10 ]
#Text=Zirin is the co-author with John Carlos of The John Carlos Story : The Sports Moment That Changed the World ( Haymarket Books , 2011 ) . [ 10 ]
#Text=He writes a blog named Edge of Sports : the weekly sports column by Dave Zirin . [ 1 ]
#Text=Controversies
#Text=Zirin has repeatedly called for sports boycotts of certain teams , states , or nations for political reasons .
#Text=Call for boycott of Arizona

#Text=On April 27 , 2010 , writing for The Guardian , Zirin called for a boycott against sports teams from Arizona , in particular the Diamondbacks , to protest the Arizona SB 1070 , the Support Our Law Enforcement and Safe Neighborhoods Act . [ 11 ] [ 12 ]
#Text=He expressed support during the 2010 NBA Playoffs for the Phoenix Suns , who went by " Los Suns " as a statement against the Arizona immigration law . [ 13 ]

column1: #Text=Support of boycotts of Israel
#Text=On June 2 , 2010 , writing for The Nation , Zirin justified the decision of the Turkish U-19 soccer team to boycott a match against Israel .
#Text=He described the Gaza flotilla raid as an act of state terror committed by the Israeli government and proposed a boycott of Israel . [ 14 ]
#Text=Criticism of Hank Williams , Jr.

#Text=On October 6 , 2011 , during a live interview conducted on the sports cable television network , ESPN , Zirin referred to Hank Williams , Jr. as racist and proslavery after Williams , the writer and singer of ESPN 's then- Monday Night Football theme song , made a political statement in which he compared multiracial US President Barack Obama to former German national socialist leader , Adolf Hitler . [ 15 ]
#Text=Defense of Barry Bonds
#Text=Zirin maintains the opinion that the aggressive hatred toward Barry Bonds is in large degree due to racism .
#Text=In 2004 Zirin wrote “ The greatest case for reasonable doubt lies in Bonds ' very late career success .
#Text=His unparalleled middle-aged majesty screams his innocence . ” [ 16 ]
#Text=However , in an undated interview , Zirin claims “ I never wrote that I " believe Bonds has never done steroids . " ”
#Text=He continues :
#Text=“ unlike oh so many others , the man never actually failed a steroids test .
#Text=Is there a ton of circumstantial evidence that the man juiced ?
#Text=Absolutely .
#Text=But he is still the best player I 've ever seen .
#Text=The best player of what will go down as the anabolic era . ” [ 17 ]
#Text=Zirin claims that , rather than steroid use , “ much of the reaction to Bonds is simply bad old-fashioned racism ” . [ 18 ]
#Text=Some of his articles and interviews defending Bonds include :
#Text=Reasonable Doubt : Why Barry Bonds is Not on Steroids , ( March 27/28 , 2004 )
#Text=The Juice and the Noose ( November/December 2006 )
#Text=The Unforgiven : Jack Johnson and Barry Bonds , Edge of Sports ( June 19 , 2007 )
#Text=Barry Bonds : Steroids , Scapegoats and Sweet Satisfaction , Edge of Sports ( August 9 , 2007 )
#Text=Indicted ! : Barry Bonds Busted by a Broken System , Edge of Sports ( November 15 , 2007 )
#Text=Bosses ’ Boycott : The Bonds Vanishes , Edge of Sports ( May 12 , 2008 )
#Text=No Softballs : Dave Zirin ( undated interview )
